note.data: Moore's Law is a trend that states: Every year or two, the capacities of computers have doubled inexpensively
Computers and the Internet are being used in industry, research, health care, social good, communication, entertainment and more...
A bit is the smallest data item in a computer; it can have the value of 0 or 1
ARPANET allowed multiple users to send and receive information simultaneously over the same communication path
The ARPANET network operated with a technique called packet switching, where data was sent in small bundles called packets
The TCP/IP protocol for communicating over the ARPANET became known as Transmission Control Protocol (TCP)
In October 1994, the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization was founded.
One of W3C's primary goals is to make the web universally accessible - regardless of disability, language or culture
Technologies standardized by W3C are called Recommendations
Current recommendations include HTML5, CSS and XML
A web page is nothing more than an HTML document. When the user tries to access a website, a web server locates the requested html file and sends it to the user's browser
HTML documents contain hyperlinks, which when clicked, loads a specified web document
Hyperlinks can also reference e-mail addresses by addressing mailto:emailAddress instead of a webpage URL
URIs (Uniform Resource Identifiers) identify resources on the internet
URIs that start with http:// are called URLs (Uniform Resource Locators)
URL contains information that directs a browser to the resource that the user wishes to access
When accessing a URL, a web browser sends an HTTP request to the server.
The word GET is an HTTP method indicating that the client wishes to obtain a resource from the server
Browsers often cache recently viewed web pages for quick reloading
If there is no difference between the version of the web page in the cache vs. the version in the web server, your browsing experience is sped up
The two most common HTTP request types are GET and POST
A post request typically posts (or sends) data to the server
To request documents from web servers, users must know the hostnames on which the web server resides
Users can request documents from a local server or a remote server
Local web servers can be accessed through your computer's name or through 'localhost' which translates to IP Address: 127.0.0.1
The Apache HTTP Server is currently the most popular web server
To access an html file called 'example.html' in directory 'chapter/figure/' in the local server, you must access the URL of the form: 'http://localhost/example.html'
HTML5 is a special type of computer language called a markup language
It's designed to specify the content and structure of web pages in a portable manner
HTML enables developers to create content that will render across a range of devices such as phones, computers, and tablets
Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) are used to specify the presentation or styling of elements on a web page
CSS was designed to style portable web pages independently of their content and structure
CSS allows the developer to easily change the look of the website by swapping out style sheets for another
